Package javelin.model.unit

Class Squad

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.unit.Squad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class Squad
extends Actor
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A group of units that the player controls as a overworld game unit. If a player loses all his squads the game ends. TODO when this breaks the 1000 line limit an easy fix is to turn members into a SquadMemmbers class. See sort().
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • active

        public static Squad active
        See Javelin.act().

      • members

        public java.util.ArrayList<Combatant> members
        Which units are in this squad.

      • gold

        public int gold
        Gold pieces (currency). 1GP = 10 silver pieces. 1SP=10 copper pieces.

      • equipment

        public Equipment equipment
        Items carried by each of the members. Since the BattleAi doesn't use items having this as a Squad filed is the best choice performance-wise.

      • hourselapsed

        public long hourselapsed
        Start at morning.

      • transport

        public Transport transport
        See Transport.

      • lasttown

        public Town lasttown
        Last visited town by a squad. Ideally this should always be a Town but in practice should never be null.

      • strategic

        public java.lang.Boolean strategic
        false will never prompt to skip battles.

      • lastterrain

        public Terrain lastterrain
        Terrain type this squad is coming from after movement.

      • resources

        public int resources
        See Also:
        Resource

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Sorts alphabetically, with all mercenaries to the final of the members list, making it easier to overcome some current UI limitations. TODO this shouldn't be public but ensure by the architecure. A solution would be to make members a class of its own (not a List) which exposes a singgle add methods like add(Combatant) and add(Combatant, List). This needs some rewriting in the code and also making sure Cloning works as intended both for shallow and deep oprateions.

      • join

        public void join​(Squad s)
        Parameters:
        s - Takes this squad, disband() it and join with the current instance.

      • eat

        public float eat()
        Returns:
        The sum of Monster.size() for this squad.

                 WorldScreen world)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called on each instance once per day.
        Overrides:
        turn in class Actor
        Parameters:
        time - Current hour, starting from hour zero at the beggining of the game.

      • spotenemies

        public java.lang.String spotenemies​(java.util.List<Combatant> opponents,
                                    Actor target)
        Spot a group of enemies.
        Parameters:
        target - If not null, will only shown information if adjacent in the WorldScreen.
        Returns:
        A list with the name of the given Combatants, replaced with "?" when failed to #perceive() properly.

      • hide

        public boolean hide​(java.util.List<Combatant> foes)
        Represents a situation in which a group of hostile Combatant s is approaching this group. The foes must first be heard successfully and then a #hide() attempt is performed.
        Returns:
        true if hide is successful and player gives input to stay hidden (confirmation).

      • bribe

        public boolean bribe​(java.util.List<Combatant> foes)
        The squad tries to parley with the enemy Combatants, possibly bribing or hirimg them to avoid the fight.
        Returns:
        false if the fight is to proceed.

      • ellapse

        public void ellapse​(int timecost)
        Parameters:
        timecost - Updates hourselapsed and any side-effects.

      • move

        public float move​(boolean ellapse,
                  Terrain t,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Parameters:
        x - World coordinate.
        y - World coordinate.
        Returns:
        Like #speed() but return time in hours.

      • speed

        public int speed​(Terrain t,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Parameters:
        x - World coordinate.
        y - World coordinate.
        Returns:
        The land speed movement overland in miles per hour. This is the amount covered in an hour but the correspoinding movement per day is less since it has to account for sleep, resting, etc.

      • swim

        public boolean swim()
        A squad cannot move on water if any of the combatants can't swim. Alternatively a boat or airship will let non-swimming squads move on water.
        Returns:
        true if this squad can move on water.
        See Also:
        #MISSING()

      • seesurroundings

        public void seesurroundings​(int vision)
        Discover a World area in a radius around current position.
        Parameters:
        vision - Perceive roll with circumstance bonuses.
        See Also:
        WorldScreen#discovered, Squad#perceive(boolean)

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()

      • getel

        public java.lang.Integer getel​(int attackerel)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an Incursion.reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Specified by:
        getel in class Actor
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level...
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        Actor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)

      • getmercenaries

        public java.util.ArrayList<Combatant> getmercenaries()
        Returns:
        A new list contianing all mercenaries in this squad.
        See Also:
        Combatant.mercenary

      • getworst

        public Combatant getworst​(Skill s)

      • heal

        public int heal()
        Returns:
        The highest take 10 roll of the current Squad. Creatures that are injured or worse won't be able to heal others. If nobody can heal, returns Integer.MIN_VALUE.
        See Also:
        Combatant.getstatus()

      • getel

        public int getel()

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(Monster m)
        Returns:
        true if there's a non-mercenary monster of this type in the current squad.
        See Also:
        Combatant.mercenary
